Detailed Description

This class implements conditional learning objects as a map.

Learning a conditional distribution P(X | Y) consists in using a map of non-conditional learning objects. This map contains, for each possible value of Y a non-conditional learning object on X. These non-conditional learning objects are added using the plLearnDistributionTable::push and plLearnDistributionTable::push_default methods.

See Also
plCndLearnObject

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

plLearnDistributionTable::plLearnDistributionTable ( const plVariablesConjunction &  left_vars,
const plVariablesConjunction &  right_vars,
const plNonCndLearnObject &  init_object 
)

Constructor when using the same type for non contional learning objects for all the values of the right variables.

init_object will be used as initilization even after calling reset() function

Member Function Documentation

plCndDistribution plLearnDistributionTable::get_cnd_distribution ( ) const
virtual

Constructs the corresponding learnt conditional distribution.

It's equivalent to calling get_distribution_table but the returned distribution is read-only and thus is more efficient. Moreover, if no default learning object is inserted (no call to push_default), then the returned conditional distribution will contain a uniform distribution for the right values that have never been inserted.

Implements plLearnCndObject.

plDistributionTable plLearnDistributionTable::get_distribution_table ( ) const

Creates the distribution map corresponding to the learnt conditional distribution.

If no default learning object is provided using push_default, then the returned distribution map does not contain a default function for the right values that have never been inserted. Consider calling push_default on the returned distribution map in order to customize it.

const plNonCndLearnObject* plLearnDistributionTable::get_learnt_object_for_value ( const plValues &  right_value) const

Returns a pointer to the non conditional learning object corresponding to the right_value value of the right variables.

Returns 0 if right_value has never been seen.

Referenced by plCndLearnObject< T >::get_learnt_object_for_value().

unsigned int plLearnDistributionTable::get_n_parameters ( ) const
virtual

Returns the ACTUAL number of parameters.

It could be different from the number of parameters returned by get_parameters.

For example, the actual number of parameters of a N dimensional normal distribution is N + N*(N+1)/2 because the covariance matrix is symmetric.

Implements plLearnObject.

void plLearnDistributionTable::get_total_weights ( std::vector< plFloat > &  w) const

Returns, for each right value, the total weight of the inserted points.

virtual void plLearnDistributionTable::Output ( std::ostream &  out) const
protectedvirtual

Implements plObject.

void plLearnDistributionTable::push ( const plNonCndLearnObject &  learn_object,
const plValues &  value 
)

Inserts a new non-conditional learning object with a given right value.

A clone of the passed learn_object is created and stored internally (i.e. with no side-effect on the passed learn_object).

void plLearnDistributionTable::push ( const plNonCndLearnObject &  learn_object,
int  value 
)

Inserts a new non-conditional learning object with a given right value.

A clone of the passed learn_object is created and stored internally (i.e. with no side-effect on the passed learn_object).

void plLearnDistributionTable::push ( const plNonCndLearnObject &  learn_object,
plFloat  value 
)

Inserts a new non-conditional learning object with a given right value.

A clone of the passed learn_object is created and stored internally (i.e. with no side-effect on the passed learn_object).

void plLearnDistributionTable::push_default ( const plNonCndLearnObject &  default_learn_object)

Inserts a new non-conditional learning object as a default one for learning distributions that correspond to right values that have not been inserted using push().

A clone of the passed default_learn_object is created and stored internally (i.e. with no side-effect on the passed default_learn_object).

void plLearnDistributionTable::reset ( )
virtual

Resets learning to its initial state.

Reimplemented from plLearnObject.
